basics.name: Sanan Hasanov
basics.label: Computer Science Researcher
basics.summary: Ph.D. student and Graduate Research Assistant at the University of Central Florida, specializing in kernel configuration research, automated script engineering, and configuration-aware fuzzing for Linux kernel security.

work.name: University of Central Florida, Orlando, FL
work.summary: Leading a team in kernel configuration research, engineering and deploying automation scripts, initiating configuration-aware fuzzing for Linux kernel security, and authoring research papers.

work.name: Trail of Bits, New York City, NY
work.summary: Contributed to value generation logic for Medusa, utilizing goroutines for data extraction and corpus collection, and refactored the tracing logic of Medusa.

work.name: Margin Research, New York City, NY
work.summary: Developed tools for open-source repositories, integrated custom security tools into the Reagent platform, and authored a guide on smart contract vulnerabilities.

education.institution: University of Central Florida, Orlando, FL

publications.name: Can You Fuzz Me Now? Overcoming Configuration Blind Spots via Configuration-aware Kernel Fuzzing
publications.summary: Authors: Sanan Hasanov, Stefan Nagy, Paul Gazzillo.

publications.name: A Little Goes a Long Way Tuning Configuration Selection for Continuous Kernel Fuzzing
publications.publisher: 47th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE)
publications.summary: Authors: Sanan Hasanov, Stefan Nagy, Paul Gazzillo.
